titleproper.value: Guide to the Debra Miller Collection <num>MSS.544</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-01-25T18:29:25</date>

extent.value: in half manuscript box and 1 folder in shared housing

abstract.value: Debra Miller is an LGBTQ activist, singer, actress, performer, and an active member of the New York art scene during the 1980s. The Debra Miller Collection is comprised of postcards, event flyers and programs from artistic performances, and a local newspaper. An excerpt of a theater script is available with written notations from the <emph render="italic">Arts for Life: A Festival for Nuclear Disarmament</emph> in 1982, in which Miller was the stage manager. The collection also contains a photocopy of Miller's identification card as a performer at the Women's One World Festival in New York City (WOW Café) in 1981.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Debra Miller Collection; MSS 544; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Donated by Debra Miller in January of 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.106.
Debra Miller is a performer, musician, actress, and an LGBTQ activist. She was an active performer at the WOW Café in the 1980s. As of 2018, Miller currently resides in Los Angeles, California.

The Debra Miller Collection is comprised of postcards, event flyers and programs from artistic performances, and a local newspaper. An excerpt of a theater script is available with written notations from the <emph render="italic">Arts for Life: A Festival for Nuclear Disarmament</emph>in 1982, in which Miller was the stage manager. The collection also contains a photocopy of Miller's identification card as a performer at the Women's One World Festival in New York City (WOW Café) in 1981.

subject.value: Experimental theater -- New York (State) -- New York.
